   19: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   20: %%% File    : wx_basic_SUITE.erl
   21: %%% Author  : Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   22: %%% Description : Basic SUITE, some simple tests to show that the basics 
   23: %%%               are working.
   24: %%% Created :  3 Nov 2008 by Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   25: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   26: -module(wx_basic_SUITE).
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   28: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: -export([silent_start/1, create_window/1, several_apps/1, wx_api/1, wx_misc/1,
   32:          data_types/1, enums/1, wx_object/1, undef_in_handle_info/1, undef_in_terminate/1,
   33:          undef_handle_event/1, undef_handle_call/1, undef_handle_cast/1, undef_handle_info/1,
   34:          undef_code_change/1, undef_terminate1/1, undef_terminate2/1
   35:         ]).
   36: 
   37: -include("wx_test_lib.hrl").
   38: 
   39: %% Initialization functions.
   40: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   41:     wx_test_lib:init_per_suite(Config).
   42: 
   43: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   44:     wx_test_lib:end_per_suite(Config).
   45: 
   46: init_per_testcase(Func,Config) ->
   47:     wx_test_lib:init_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   48: end_per_testcase(Func,Config) -> 
   49:     wx_test_lib:end_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   50: 
   51: %% SUITE specification
   52: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}, {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   53: 
   54: all() -> 
   55:     [silent_start, create_window, several_apps, wx_api, wx_misc,
   56:      data_types, enums, wx_object, {group, undef_callbacks},
   57:      undef_in_handle_info, undef_in_terminate].
   58: 
   59: groups() -> 
   60:     [{undef_callbacks, [],
   61:      [undef_handle_event, undef_handle_call, undef_handle_cast, undef_handle_info,
   62:       undef_code_change, undef_terminate1, undef_terminate2]}].
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70:   
   71: %% The test cases
   72: 
   73: %% test silent start of wx
   74: silent_start(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
   75: silent_start(_Config) ->
   76:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new([])),
   77:     wx:destroy(),
   78: 
   79:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new([{silent_start, true}])),
   80:     wx:destroy(),
   81: 
   82:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new([{silent_start, true}, {debug, verbose}])),
   83:     wx:destroy(),
   84: 
   85:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new([{silent_start, false}])),
   86:     wx:destroy(),
   87: 
   88:     ?mr('EXIT', catch wx:new([{silent_start, foo}])),
   89:     
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: %% create and test creating a window
   93: create_window(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
   94: create_window(Config) ->
   95:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
   96:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "Hello World")),
   97:     timer:sleep(1000),
   98:     ?m(true,wxWindow:show(Frame, [])),
   99:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  100: 
  101: %% create several windows from independent processes 
  102: %% to simulate several applications and test creating a window
  103: several_apps(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  104: several_apps(Config) -> 
  105:     Parent = self(),
  106:     Pids = [spawn_link(fun() -> several_apps(Parent, N, Config) end) 
  107: 	    || N <- lists:seq(1,4)],
  108:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  109:     Wait = fun(Pid,Acc) ->
  110: 		   receive {complete, Pid} -> Acc
  111: 		   after 20000 -> [Pid|Acc]
  112: 		   end
  113: 	   end,
  114:     Res = lists:foldl(Wait, [], Pids),
  115:     [Pid ! quit || Pid <- Pids],
  116: 
  117:     Dbg = fun(Pid) ->
  118: 		  io:format("Stack ~p~n",[erlang:process_info(Pid, current_stacktrace)]),
  119: 		  io:format("Stack ~p~n",[erlang:process_info(Pid)])
  120: 	  end,
  121:     case Res of
  122: 	[] -> ok;
  123: 	Failed ->
  124: 	    [Dbg(Pid)|| Pid <- Failed]
  125:     end,
  126:     case wx_test_lib:user_available(Config) of
  127: 	true ->
  128: 	    receive {'EXIT',_,foo} -> ok end;
  129: 	false ->
  130: 	    ok
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: several_apps(Parent, N, Config) ->
  134:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  135:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "Hello World No:" ++ 
  136: 				     integer_to_list(N))),
  137:     create_menus(Frame),
  138:     wxFrame:connect(Frame,size),
  139:     ?m(true,wxWindow:show(Frame, [])),
  140:     receive 
  141: 	#wx{obj=Frame, event=#wxSize{}} ->
  142: 	    Parent ! {complete, self()}
  143:     end,
  144:     receive quit -> ok end,
  145:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config),
  146:     exit(foo).
  147: 
  148: 
  149: %% Test the wx.erl api functionality.
  150: wx_api(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  151: wx_api(Config) ->
  152:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()), 
  153:     ?m(true, wx:is_null(Wx)),
  154:     Null = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:null()),
  155:     ?m(true, wx:is_null(Null)),
  156:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "WX API: " ++ unicode:characters_to_list("åäöÅÄÖ"))),
  157:     ?m(false, wx:is_null(Frame)),
  158:     ?m(wxFrame, wx:getObjectType(Frame)),
  159:     Env = ?mr(wx_env, wx:get_env()),
  160:     %% Test some error cases 
  161:     erase(wx_env),
  162:     ?m({'EXIT', {{wx,unknown_env},_}},wxWindow:show(Frame, [])),
  163:     ?m({'EXIT', {{wx,unknown_env},_}},wx:debug(2)),
  164:     
  165:     ?m(ok,wx:set_env(Env)),
  166:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(1)),
  167:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(2)),
  168:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(0)),
  169:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(none)),
  170:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(verbose)),
  171:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(trace)),
  172:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(driver)),
  173:     
  174:     Mem = ?mr(wx_mem, wx:create_memory(10)),
  175:     ?m(true, is_binary(wx:get_memory_bin(Mem))),
  176:     ?mt(foo, wx:typeCast(Frame, foo)),
  177: 
  178:     %% wx:debug(16),
  179:     RecBatch = fun() ->
  180:         	       wx:batch(fun() -> create_menus(Frame) end)
  181:                end,
  182:     ?m(batch_ret, wx:batch(fun() -> RecBatch(), batch_ret end)),
  183:     ?m(ok, wx:foreach(fun(A) -> true = lists:member(A,[1,2,3,4,5]) end,
  184: 		      lists:seq(1,5))),
  185:     ?m([2,3,4,5,6], wx:map(fun(A) -> A+1 end, lists:seq(1,5))),
  186:     ?m({5,15}, wx:foldl(fun(A,{_,Acc}) -> {A,A+Acc} end, {0,0},
  187: 			lists:seq(1,5))),
  188:     ?m({1,15}, wx:foldr(fun(A,{_,Acc}) -> {A,A+Acc} end, {0,0},
  189: 			lists:seq(1,5))),
  190:     ?m(ok,wx:debug(none)),
  191:     
  192:     ?m(ball, wx:batch(fun() -> throw(ball), batch_ret end)),
  193:     ?m({'EXIT', door}, wx:batch(fun() -> exit(door), batch_ret end)),
  194:     ?m({'EXIT',{message,_ST}}, 
  195:        wx:batch(fun() -> erlang:error(message), batch_ret end)),
  196:     
  197: 
  198:     ?m({'EXIT',_},wxWindow:show(wx:null(), [])),
  199:     ?m(true,wxWindow:show(Frame, [])),
  200:     Temp = ?mt(wxButton, wxButton:new(Frame, -1)),
  201:     ?m(ok,wxButton:setLabel(Temp, "Testing")),
  202:     ?m(ok,wxButton:destroy(Temp)),
  203:     ?m({'EXIT',_},wxButton:getLabel(Temp)),
  204:     ?m(ok,wxButton:setLabel(Temp, "Testing")), %% Should generate an error report
  205:     ?m({'EXIT',_},wxButton:getLabel(Temp)),
  206: 
  207:     case wx_test_lib:user_available(Config) of
  208: 	true -> 	    
  209: 	    %% Hmm popup doesn't return until mouse is pressed.
  210: 	    Menu = wxMenu:new(),
  211: 	    wxMenu:append(Menu, 0, "Press", []),
  212: 	    wxMenu:append(Menu, 1, "Me", []),
  213: 	    ?m(true, wxWindow:popupMenu(Frame, Menu)),
  214: 	    %% This didn't work for a while
  215: 	    ?m(true, wx:batch(fun() -> 
  216: 				      wxMenu:append(Menu, 2, "AGAIN", []),
  217: 				      wxWindow:popupMenu(Frame, Menu) 
  218: 			      end)),
  219: 	    ok;
  220: 	_ ->
  221: 	    ignore
  222:     end,
  223:     
  224: %%     dbg:tracer(),
  225: %%     {_, _Port, Server, _Dbg} = wx:get_env(),
  226: %%     dbg:p(Server, [m, call]),
  227: %%     dbg:p(new, [m, call]),
  228: %%     dbg:tpl(wxe_server,'_', [{'_', [], [{return_trace}]}]),
  229:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame,Config).
  230: 		  
  231: create_menus(Frame) ->
  232:     MenuBar = ?mt(wxMenuBar, wxMenuBar:new()),
  233:     File    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  234:     Help    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  235:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(Help, ?wxID_ABOUT, "&About", [])),
  236:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(Help, ?wxID_HELP, "&Help", [])),
  237:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(File, ?wxID_EXIT, "Exit", [])), 
  238:     ?m(ok,wxFrame:connect(Frame, command_menu_selected)), 
  239:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:append(MenuBar, File, "&File")),
  240:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:append(MenuBar, Help, "&Help")),
  241:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:setMenuBar(Frame,MenuBar)).
  242: 
  243: 
  244: %% Test the wx_misc.erl api functionality.
  245: wx_misc(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  246: wx_misc(_Config) ->
  247:     wx:new([{debug, trace}]),
  248:     put(wx_test_verbose, true),
  249:     ?m(ok, wx_misc:bell()),
  250:     ?m(true, length(wx_misc:getUserId()) > 0),
  251:     ?m(true, is_list(wx_misc:getEmailAddress())),
  252:     Home = ?m([_|_], wx_misc:getHomeDir()),
  253:     ?m(true, filelib:is_dir(Home)),
  254:     ?m(true, length(wx_misc:getOsDescription()) > 0),
  255:     IsLitte = case <<1:32/native>> of 
  256: 		  <<1:8, 0:24>> -> true;
  257: 		  <<0:24,1:16>> -> false
  258: 	      end,
  259:     ?m(IsLitte, wx_misc:isPlatformLittleEndian()),
  260:     ?m(true, is_boolean(wx_misc:isPlatform64Bit())),
  261:     
  262:     ?mr(wxMouseState, wx_misc:getMouseState()),
  263:     ?m({_,_}, wx_misc:getMousePosition()),
  264:     
  265:     %% Don't hold home down when testing :-)
  266:     ?m(false, wx_misc:getKeyState(?WXK_HOME)), 
  267: 
  268:     
  269:     %% wx:shutdown()  %% How do you test this?
  270: 
  271:     ?m(false, wx_misc:isBusy()),
  272:     ?m(ok, wx_misc:beginBusyCursor([])),
  273:     ?m(true, wx_misc:isBusy()),
  274:     ?m(ok, wx_misc:endBusyCursor()),
  275:     
  276:     %%?m(true, is_boolean(wx_misc:setDetectableAutoRepeat(true)),
  277:     Curr  = wx_misc:getCurrentId(),
  278:     ?m(true, is_integer(Curr)),
  279:     NewId = wx_misc:newId(),
  280:     ?m(ok, wx_misc:registerId(NewId+1)),
  281:     ?m(true, (NewId+1) /= wx_misc:newId()),
  282:     
  283:     wx:destroy().
  284: 
  285: 
  286: %% Check that all the data_types works in communication
  287: %% between erlang and c++ thread.
  288: data_types(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  289: data_types(_Config) ->
  290:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  291: 
  292:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "Data Types"),
  293:     wxFrame:connect(Frame, show),
  294:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  295:     receive #wx{event=#wxShow{}} -> ok
  296:     after 1000 -> exit(show_timeout)
  297:     end,
  298: 
  299:     CDC = wxClientDC:new(Frame),
  300: 
  301:     %% From wx.erl
  302:     %% The following classes are implemented directly as erlang types: <br />
  303:     %% wxPoint={x,y},wxSize={w,h},wxRect={x,y,w,h},wxColour={r,g,b [,a]},wxString=[integer],
  304:     %% wxGBPosition={r,c},wxGBSpan={rs,cs},wxGridCellCoords={r,c}.
  305: 
  306:     %% Strings
  307:     ?m("Data Types", wxFrame:getTitle(Frame)),
  308: 
  309:     %% Doubles
  310:     ?m(ok, wxDC:setUserScale(CDC, 123.45, 234.67)),
  311:     ?m({123.45,234.67}, wxDC:getUserScale(CDC)),
  312: 
  313:     %% Array of doubles
  314:     try wxGraphicsContext:create(CDC) of
  315: 	GC ->
  316: 	    wxGraphicsContext:setFont(GC, ?wxITALIC_FONT, {0, 0, 50}),
  317: 	    Ws = wxGraphicsContext:getPartialTextExtents(GC, "a String With More Than 16 Characters"),
  318: 	    _ = lists:foldl(fun(Width, {Index, Acc}) ->
  319: 				    if Width >= Acc, Width < 600 -> {Index+1, Width};
  320: 				       true -> throw({bad_float, Width, Index, Acc})
  321: 				    end
  322: 			    end, {0,0.0}, Ws),
  323: 	    ok
  324:     catch _:_ -> %% GC not supported on this platform
  325: 	    ok
  326:     end,
  327: 
  328:     %% Colors input is 3 or 4 tuple, returns are 4 tuples
  329:     ?m(ok, wxDC:setTextForeground(CDC, {100,10,1})),
  330:     ?m({100,10,1,255}, wxDC:getTextForeground(CDC)),
  331:     ?m(ok, wxDC:setTextForeground(CDC, {100,10,1,43})),
  332:     ?m({100,10,1,43}, wxDC:getTextForeground(CDC)),
  333: 
  334:     %% Bool
  335:     ?m(ok, wxDC:setAxisOrientation(CDC, true, false)),
  336:     ?m(true, is_boolean(wxDC:isOk(CDC))),
  337: 
  338:     %% wxCoord 
  339:     ?m(true, is_integer(wxDC:maxX(CDC))),
  340:     
  341:     %% wxSize
  342:     ?m({_,_}, wxWindow:getSize(Frame)),
  343:     wx:debug(none),
  344:     %% DateTime 
  345:     DateTime = {Date, _Time} = calendar:now_to_datetime(os:timestamp()),
  346:     io:format("DateTime ~p ~n",[DateTime]),
  347:     Cal = ?mt(wxCalendarCtrl, wxCalendarCtrl:new(Frame, ?wxID_ANY, [{date,DateTime}])),
  348:     ?m({Date,_}, wxCalendarCtrl:getDate(Cal)),
  349:     ?m(true, is_boolean(wxCalendarCtrl:setDate(Cal,DateTime))),
  350:     ?m({Date,_}, wxCalendarCtrl:getDate(Cal)),
  351: 
  352:     %% Images, test sending and reading binaries
  353:     Colors = << <<200:8, 199:8, 198:8 >> || _ <- lists:seq(1, 128*64) >>,
  354:     Alpha  = << <<255:8>> || _ <- lists:seq(1, 128*64) >>,
  355:     ImgRGB = ?mt(wxImage, wxImage:new(128, 64, Colors)),
  356:     ?m(true, wxImage:ok(ImgRGB)),
  357:     ?m(false, wxImage:hasAlpha(ImgRGB)),
  358:     ?m(ok, case wxImage:getData(ImgRGB) of Colors -> ok; Other -> Other end),
  359: 
  360:     ImgRGBA = ?mt(wxImage, wxImage:new(128, 64, Colors, Alpha)),
  361:     ?m(true, wxImage:ok(ImgRGBA)),
  362:     ?m(true, wxImage:hasAlpha(ImgRGBA)),
  363:     ?m(ok, case wxImage:getData(ImgRGBA) of Colors -> ok; Other -> Other end),
  364:     ?m(ok, case wxImage:getAlpha(ImgRGBA) of Alpha -> ok; Other -> Other end),
  365: 
  366:     wxClientDC:destroy(CDC),
  367:     %%wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame,Config).
  368:     wx:destroy().
  369: 
  370: enums(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  371: enums(_Config) ->
  372:     %% Test that all needed enums are available and have not changed value
  373:     wx_test_enums:test().
  374: 
  375: wx_object(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  376: wx_object(Config) ->
  377:     wx:new(),
  378:     Me = self(),
  379:     Init = fun() ->
  380: 		   Frame0 = wxFrame:new(wx:null(), ?wxID_ANY, "Test wx_object", [{size, {500, 400}}]),
  381: 		   Frame = wx_object:set_pid(Frame0, self()),
  382: 		   Sz = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxHORIZONTAL),
  383: 		   Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame),
  384: 		   wxSizer:add(Sz, Panel, [{flag, ?wxEXPAND}, {proportion, 1}]),
  385: 		   wxPanel:connect(Panel, size, [{skip, true}]),
  386: 		   wxPanel:connect(Panel, paint, [callback, {userData, Me}]),
  387: 		   wxWindow:show(Frame),
  388: 		   {Frame, {Frame, Panel}}
  389: 	   end,
  390:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wx_obj_test:start([{init, Init}])),
  391: 
  392:     timer:sleep(500),
  393:     ?m(ok, check_events(flush())),
  394: 
  395:     Me = self(),
  396:     ?m({call, foobar, {Me, _}}, wx_object:call(Frame, foobar)),
  397:     ?m(ok, wx_object:cast(Frame, foobar2)),
  398:     ?m([{cast, foobar2}|_], flush(true)),
  399: 
  400:     ?m(Frame, wx_obj_test:who_are_you(Frame)),
  401:     {call, {Frame,Panel}, _} = wx_object:call(Frame, fun(US) -> US end),
  402:     ?m(false, wxWindow:getParent(Panel) =:= Frame),
  403:     ?m(true, wx:equal(wxWindow:getParent(Panel),Frame)),
  404:     flush(),
  405:     ReqId = wx_object:send_request(Frame, fun(_US) -> timer:sleep(10), yes1 end),
  406:     timeout = wx_object:wait_response(ReqId, 0),
  407:     {reply, {call, yes1, {Me,_}}} = wx_object:wait_response(ReqId, 1000),
  408:     ReqId2 = wx_object:send_request(Frame, yes2),
  409:     [Msg] = flush(true),
  410:     no_reply = wx_object:check_response(Msg, ReqId),
  411:     {reply, {call, yes2, {Me,_}}} = wx_object:check_response(Msg, ReqId2),
  412: 
  413:     FramePid = wx_object:get_pid(Frame),
  414:     io:format("wx_object pid ~p~n",[FramePid]),
  415:     FramePid ! foo3,
  416:     ?m([{info, foo3}], flush(true)),
  417: 
  418:     ?m(ok, wx_object:cast(Frame, fun(_) -> hehe end)),
  419:     ?m([{cast, hehe}|_], flush(true)),
  420:     wxWindow:refresh(Frame),
  421:     ?m([{sync_event, #wx{event=#wxPaint{}}, _}|_], flush()),
  422:     ?m(ok, wx_object:cast(Frame, fun(_) -> timer:sleep(500), slept end)),
  423:     %% The sleep above should not hinder the Paint event below
  424:     %% Which it did in my buggy handling of the sync_callback
  425:     wxWindow:refresh(Panel),
  426:     wxWindow:update(Panel),
  427:     timer:sleep(700),
  428:     ?m([{sync_event, #wx{event=#wxPaint{}}, _}, {cast, slept}|_], flush()),
  429: 
  430:     Monitor = erlang:monitor(process, FramePid),
  431:     case proplists:get_value(user, Config, false) of
  432: 	false ->
  433: 	    timer:sleep(100),
  434: 	    wxFrame:destroy(Frame);
  435: 	true ->
  436: 	    timer:sleep(500),
  437: 	    ?m(ok, wxFrame:destroy(Frame));
  438: 	_ ->
  439: 	    ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Frame, close_window, [{skip,true}])),
  440: 	    wx_test_lib:wait_for_close()
  441:     end,
  442:     ?m(ok, receive
  443: 	       {'DOWN', Monitor, _, _, _} ->
  444: 		   ?m([{terminate, wx_deleted}], flush(true)),
  445: 		   ok
  446: 	   after 1000 ->
  447: 		   Msgs = flush(),
  448: 		   io:format("Error ~p Alive ~p~n",[Msgs, is_process_alive(FramePid)])
  449: 	   end),
  450:     catch wx:destroy(),
  451:     ok.
  452: 
  453: %% Test that the server crashes correctly if the handle_event callback is
  454: %% not exported in the callback module
  455: undef_handle_event(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  456: undef_handle_event(_Config) ->
  457:     wx:new(),
  458:     {_, _, _, Pid} = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  459:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  460:     %% Mock a call to handle_event
  461:     Pid ! {wx, a, b, c, d},
  462:     ok = receive
  463:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid,
  464:          {undef, [{wx_oc_object, handle_event, _, _}|_]}} ->
  465:             ok
  466:     after 5000 ->
  467:         ct:fail(should_crash)
  468:     end.
  469: 
  470: %% Test that the server crashes correctly if the handle_call callback is
  471: %% not exported in the callback module
  472: undef_handle_call(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  473: undef_handle_call(_Config) ->
  474:     wx:new(),
  475:     Frame = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  476:     try
  477:         wx_object:call(Frame, call_msg),
  478:         ct:fail(should_crash)
  479:     catch error:{{undef, [{wx_oc_object,handle_call, _, _}|_]},
  480:                               {wx_object,call,_}} ->
  481:         ok
  482:     end.
  483: 
  484: %% Test that the server crashes correctly if the handle_cast callback is
  485: %% not exported in the callback module
  486: undef_handle_cast(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  487: undef_handle_cast(_Config) ->
  488:     wx:new(),
  489:     {_, _, _, Pid} = Frame = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  490:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  491:     wx_object:cast(Frame, cast_msg),
  492:     ok = receive
  493:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid,
  494:          {undef, [{wx_oc_object, handle_cast, _, _}|_]}} ->
  495:             ok
  496:     after 5000 ->
  497:         ct:fail(should_crash)
  498:     end.
  499: 
  500: %% Test the default implementation of handle_info if the callback module
  501: %% does not export it
  502: undef_handle_info(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  503: undef_handle_info(_Config) ->
  504:     wx:new(),
  505:     {_, _, _, Pid} = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  506:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  507:     Pid ! test,
  508:     receive
  509:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
  510:             ct:fail(should_not_crash)
  511:     after 500 ->
  512:         ok
  513:     end,
  514:     ok = wx_object:stop(Pid).
  515: 
  516: %% Test the server crashes correctly if called and the code_change callback is
  517: %% not exported in the callback module
  518: undef_code_change(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  519: undef_code_change(_Config) ->
  520:     wx:new(),
  521:     {_, _, _, Pid} = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  522:     sys:suspend(Pid),
  523:     sys:replace_state(Pid, fun([P, S, M, T]) -> [P, {new, S}, M, T] end),
  524:     {error, {'EXIT', {undef, [{wx_oc_object,code_change, [_, _, _], _}|_]}}}
  525:          = sys:change_code(Pid, wx_oc_object, old_vsn, []),
  526:     ok = sys:resume(Pid),
  527:     ok = wx_object:stop(Pid).
  528: 
  529: %% Test the default implementation of terminate if the callback module
  530: %% does not export it
  531: undef_terminate1(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  532: undef_terminate1(_Config) ->
  533:     ok = terminate([], normal).
  534: 
  535: %% Test the default implementation of terminate if the callback module
  536: %% does not export it
  537: undef_terminate2(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  538: undef_terminate2(_Config) ->
  539:     ok = terminate([{error, test}, infinity], {error, test}).
  540: 
  541: terminate(ArgsTl, Reason) ->
  542:     wx:new(),
  543:     {_, _, _, Pid} = wx_object:start(wx_oc_object, [], []),
  544:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  545:     ok = apply(wx_object, stop, [Pid|ArgsTl]),
  546:     receive
  547:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Reason} ->
  548:             ok
  549:     after 1000 ->
  550:         ct:fail(failed)
  551:     end.
  552: 
  553: %% Test that the server crashes correctly if the handle_info callback is
  554: %% calling an undefined function
  555: undef_in_handle_info(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  556: undef_in_handle_info(_Config) ->
  557:     wx:new(),
  558:     Init = ui_init_fun(),
  559:     {_, _, _, Pid} = wx_object:start(wx_obj_test,
  560:                                      [{parent, self()}, {init, Init}], []),
  561:     unlink(Pid),
  562:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  563:     Pid ! {call_undef_fun, {wx_obj_test, handle_info}},
  564:     receive
  565:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid,
  566:          {undef, [{wx_obj_test, handle_info, _, _}|_]}} ->
  567:             ok
  568:     after 1000 ->
  569:         ct:fail(failed)
  570:     end,
  571:     ok.
  572: 
  573: %% Test that the server crashes correctly if the terminate callback is
  574: %% calling an undefined function
  575: undef_in_terminate(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  576: undef_in_terminate(_Config) ->
  577:     wx:new(),
  578:     Init = ui_init_fun(),
  579:     Frame = wx_object:start(wx_obj_test,
  580:                             [{parent, self()}, {init, Init},
  581:                              {terminate, {wx_obj_test, terminate}}], []),
  582:     try
  583:         wx_object:stop(Frame),
  584:         ct:fail(should_crash)
  585:     catch error:{{undef, [{wx_obj_test, terminate, _, _}|_]}, _} ->
  586:         ok
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: ui_init_fun() ->
  590:     Init = fun() ->
  591:         Frame0 = wxFrame:new(wx:null(), ?wxID_ANY, "Test wx_object", [{size, {500, 400}}]),
  592:         Frame = wx_object:set_pid(Frame0, self()),
  593:         Sz = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxHORIZONTAL),
  594:         Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame),
  595:         wxSizer:add(Sz, Panel, [{flag, ?wxEXPAND}, {proportion, 1}]),
  596:         wxWindow:show(Frame),
  597:         {Frame, {Frame, Panel}}
  598:     end,
  599:     Init.
  600: 
  601: check_events(Msgs) ->
  602:     check_events(Msgs, 0,0).
  603: 
  604: check_events([{event, #wx{event=#wxSize{}}}|Rest], Async, Sync) ->
  605:     check_events(Rest, Async+1, Sync);
  606: check_events([{sync_event, #wx{event=#wxPaint{}}, Obj}|Rest], Async, Sync) ->
  607:     ?mt(wxPaintEvent, Obj),
  608:     check_events(Rest, Async, Sync+1);
  609: check_events([], Async, Sync) ->
  610:     case Async > 0 of  %% Test sync explicitly
  611: 	true -> ok;
  612: 	false -> {Async, Sync}
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: flush() ->
  616:     flush([], false, 1500).
  617: 
  618: flush(FilterSync) ->
  619:     flush([], FilterSync, 1500).
  620: 
  621: flush(Acc, FilterSync, Wait) ->
  622:     receive
  623:         {sync_event, _} when FilterSync ->
  624:             flush(Acc, FilterSync, Wait);
  625: 	Msg ->
  626:             flush([Msg|Acc], FilterSync, Wait div 10)
  627:     after Wait ->
  628: 	    lists:reverse(Acc)
  629:     end.
